compounds.name: Ginkgolides
moieties: is a diterpenoid trilactone with six five-membered rings. It contains a spiro[4
and a very specific tert-butyl group at one of the rings

comment: This BGC comprises a terpene synthase (LPS), a kinase, and a set of five cytochrome P450 genes (AY574248.2, ON759313.1, ON759314.1, ON759315.1, ON759316.1, ON759317.1, ON759318.1, ON759319.1, ON759320.1, ON759321.1, ON759322.1, ON759323.1, ON759324.1, ON759325.1, ON759326.1, ON759327.1, ON759328.1, ON759329.1). According to the publication, this gene cluster is located on chromosome 5 of the improved, high-quality genome assembly of G. biloba, which has not yet been submitted to the NCBI. The NCBI currently has an older draft scaffold-level assembly. The locus specified in this MiBiG entry corresponds to the scaffold housing the TPS and four CYP450s. For access to the high-quality assembly, please visit http://gigadb.org/dataset/100613.
